data.sentence: The word قَدْ comes from the root ق د and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word لِقَوْمٍ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: he separated/divided or put apart a thing from another thing, made a separation/partition, distinct/plain/clear/manifest, explain in detail, to distinguish, deciding between two things (e.g. what is true and what is not), distinct portion/section.FASALA: To set apart, separate, distinguish, set a limit, part, depart, decide, set out, divide into parts, expatiate into detail, make clear (statement), distinct, judge, narrate a thing with all its particulars. FASLUN: Distinguishing, DecisiveMUFASSALAN: Clearly explainedFUSSILAT: DetailedMUFASSALAT: Fully detailed

data.meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.
data.sentence: The word صِرَاطُ comes from the root ص ر ط and is associated with the meanings: a path which is even, wide enough and can be trodden without difficulty. A road/way/path, long sword.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word يَذَّكَّرُونَ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
